185344362.review:
If you're looking for a thrilling single-player first-person shooter that combines massive battles, creative freedom, and endless replayability, Ravenfield is the perfect game for you. Here's why you should give it a try:

Epic Battles: Ravenfield delivers large-scale battles where you can experience intense combat alongside AI teammates. Choose your playstyle—whether it's as an infantry soldier, vehicle operator, or aerial pilot—and immerse yourself in dynamic firefights.

Customizable Gameplay: From tweaking battle sizes to trying out different game modes, Ravenfield offers unparalleled customization. You can tailor the game to suit your preferences, ensuring that every session feels fresh and exciting.

User-Friendly Mods: One of the game's strongest features is its modding community. With thousands of mods available, including new weapons, vehicles, maps, and more, the possibilities are endless. You can even try out player-created campaigns for an extended experience.

Smooth and Simple Mechanics: Unlike other complex shooters, Ravenfield focuses on smooth, straightforward gameplay. It’s easy to pick up, making it enjoyable for casual players while still offering enough depth for veterans.

Offline Fun: Since Ravenfield is a single-player game, you don’t need to rely on an internet connection or other players to enjoy massive battles. It's the perfect game to play whenever and wherever you want.

Active Development: Ravenfield is constantly being updated with new features and content. The developer is highly engaged with the community, ensuring the game continues to grow and improve over time.

Whether you're a fan of sandbox games, tactical shooters, or just want to create chaos in a massive battlefield, Ravenfield provides endless fun. Don’t miss the chance to lead your army to victory—try Ravenfield today and unleash your inner battlefield commander!

This game is so enjoyable and fun to play. The bots that you can fight are annoying sometimes, but the game's bots are still amazing. There might not be many guns to start with, but if you install enough mods, you will have so many guns that you might not be able to choose which one to use. My favorite part of the game is the vehicles, they have such wonky physics that its fun, and hilarious. The bots are very smart and they can even drive. Even though I've only played for about 7 hours, this game is so good. One thing I find funny is that you can run people over, and even kick others. This game is amazing, I would recommend it to anyone that likes a first person shooter, and a funny one.

P.S.
I got this game from a good friend of mine. Good day.

184843757.review:
If Garry's Mod and Battlefield had a love child, you'd get Ravenfield. Despite its occasional frame rate dips that make my PC feel like it’s trudging through molasses, it’s hard not to fall in love with this game.

Gameplay-wise, Ravenfield delivers an exhilarating experience. It offers an incredible amount of scenarios, from massive, chaotic battles to highly customizable experiences that let you shape the game to fit your playstyle. Whether you're behind the wheel of a tank or running and gunning with a variety of weapons, each match feels fresh and chaotic, keeping you engaged for hours. The AI in my opinion can be hit or miss. Sometimes they're laughably bad, other times scarily accurate.

To get the most out of Ravenfield, mods are your best friends. The community has created a ton of amazing mods that expand on nearly every aspect of the game, from new maps and weapons to exciting new gameplay mechanics. These mods can take the experience to a whole new level, offering nearly endless variety and replayability.

A significant part of what makes Ravenfield exceptional is the dedication of its developer, Johan "SteelRaven7" Hassel. As a solo developer, his commitment to continuous updates and engagement with the community has been instrumental in the game's success. His dedication ensures that Ravenfield continues to thrive and evolve, much to the delight of its fanbase.

Overall, it's a 9/10 in my book—a must-buy for shooter enthusiasts looking for a unique blend of creativity and chaos.

184604152.review:
I bought this game for the Winter Sale when I was in seventh grade. I am now a junior in College.

 It is still in Early Access. By all accounts this is an amazing game made solo, but the developer has turned into a defacto YandereDev, going on side quests for the last 8 years rather than finishing half-decade old features. 

Conquest Mode, started in 2019, is unfinished 6 years later. Keep in mind Conquest Mode is the exact same as base game, just with a turn-based board game troop movement in-between matches. 
Story Mode, "started work immediately" in 2021, has after 4 years had 1 story mission, 1 AI-Generated SpecOps Mission, and maybe 3 or 4 character illustrations. 
I dont think i've seen a new vehicle or gun added to the game in half a decade, but don't quote me on this one.

Infact, speaking of quotes, there is one right below what i'm typing; "The full release of Ravenfield is scheduled to happen around 2021." It is now 2024 and the game is primed to finish by 2026. 

Overall, the game itself is severely outdated. Earlier gun+vehicle models and maps are extremely lacking in graphics & animations compared to their slightly younger counterparts, at times leaving you a loadout of a 3-poly roblox pistol & sword, and a high definition silenced sten gun. The developers insistence to go on wild goose chases for unimportant and time-consuming game features has led to a striving modding community to pick up the slack, leading to newer updates sometimes focusing exclusively on just bugs & modding updates, further neglecting the game and further driving the need for modders. 

It should not take 11 years to make a simple singleplayer FPS base with a 2 hour story mode, a turn-based risk board, and a generalized modding base to edit the game. It shouldn't have taken 11 years to make a simple singleplayer yandere murder game, and yet here we are.

- No multiplayer
- Game feels lackluster
- AI is broken
- lack of UI elements other than colors of the teams to tell you who you're shooting at (ESPECIALLY VEHICLES)
- Mod control / support is also broken

I don't see how this has overwhelmingly positive reviews. The AI is absolutely broken on any difficulty. Air vehicles are so overpowered that anything else is useless. They're nearly impossible to take down even with AA, and when you do, the AI just jumps right out so it's not even considered as a kill. There is a big lack of text or ui that allows you to tell what team the vehicle is other than very small red or blue indications on them which are very difficult to see in distance or on first glance. 

It's not fun. It's just frustrating and annoying being a death simulator. AI just camps across the map on foot with pinpoint accuracy or spawn kills you with air vehicles. Mods also don't refresh when you download them, resulting in you having to restart the entire game to get them to show up. On the subject of mods, they're cool, but also don't do much to change the fundamentals of the game. 

I remember playing this around 2018 and not much has changed. For a game being out for nearly 8 years and barely made minor improvements since then is insane. It's only fun for one game, then it becomes a pain. I'd rather play Battlefield. At least I have a fighting chance.

184264923.review:
Really solid, bare-bones shooter game. You pick a map, game style, weapons and vehicles, then play. If you grew up on single player shooters like quake and unreal tournament, it's a lot like that. Scratches the itch of shooting NPCs while playing capture the flag or other game modes.
The base game is solid but feels basic, so go to the workshop and check out the mods. There's tons. Lots of maps, weapons, vehicles, character models, and more. Make it a Star Wars experience, or recreate WW2 battles, or fight like vikings. If you enjoy a customizable fighting experience without other people, this game is a lot of fun. Closest multiplayer game would be Battle-Bit, if you want a comparison
I got this game not long after it launched on steam early access. It has been in development for a long time and does not promise to provide a story-mode experience. Never the less, I find it to be a fun and relaxing game to play if I want to quickly jump into some fun.

184254156.review:
My criticism for this game is almost identical to my criticism for ground branch. The updates are very slow and underwhelming and this game is heavily propped up by it's modding community. However, Ravenfield is half the price, has a single developer, has some of the most expansive and adaptive mods available on the workshop, and is sold as a sandbox. If you're not modding this game, then you are missing the entire point. 

Some of my favorite mods in the workshop are the star wars mod pack collection, the vanilla plus series, the advanced health mods, the zombie mod, and the map "Oblast Highway". Beware, there are some mods that were broken by old updates and never got updated or marked as nonfunctional so modding can be hit or miss. I will also add that customizing your matches (especially if you use a heavy amount of mods) can be time consuming and tedious. However, you can save configurations so you don't to constantly go through that proccess.

Overall, if you want an extremely customizable battlefield style sandbox shooter with some of the best mod support available on the workshop, then Ravenfield is fantastic. Just understand this is not a download and start playing kind of game. You have to enjoy making small changes in menus and experimenting

184158841.review:
Ravenfield is a fun, fast-paced FPS that focuses on delivering chaotic battles between teams of AI soldiers. It’s a simple game at heart, with 8-bit-inspired graphics and no real storyline, but it makes up for it with great shooting mechanics, endless modding potential, and an addictive “just one more match” feel. While it has its shortcomings—like a glitchy conquest mode and a lack of narrative—it’s still a highly enjoyable sandbox shooter that’s perfect for some low-stakes fun.

Great Shooting Mechanics:

The shooting mechanics in Ravenfield are solid and satisfying, with a variety of weapons to suit your playstyle. Whether you’re sniping enemies from afar, going all-out with a shotgun, or mowing down waves of AI with an LMG, the combat feels smooth and impactful. The game keeps things simple but effective, giving you just enough realism to feel tactical while still staying accessible. Watching enemies ragdoll hilariously after a well-placed shot never gets old, adding a layer of goofy charm to the experience.

8-Bit Graphics That Are Surprisingly Fun:

The minimalist, blocky art style of Ravenfield won’t win any beauty contests, but it fits the game perfectly. The simple visuals keep things clear and easy to follow, even when the screen is filled with explosions, vehicles, and dozens of AI soldiers. While the graphics might feel dated to some, they contribute to the game’s lighthearted, arcade-style vibe, making it less about realism and more about pure fun.

Amazing Modded Content:

One of Ravenfield’s biggest strengths is its modding community. The Steam Workshop is packed with mods that bring fresh life to the game, from new maps and weapons to custom skins and vehicles. Want to fight as Star Wars stormtroopers? Done. Want to use ridiculous weapons like lightsabers or wacky grenade launchers? You can do that too. The mods add so much variety and creativity to Ravenfield that it’s almost like a new game every time you dive into the Workshop.

Conquest Mode and Lack of Story:

The biggest downside to Ravenfield is its lack of polish in certain areas. There’s no story to speak of, which makes the game feel a bit hollow for players who prefer a narrative-driven experience. The Conquest mode—an attempt at adding a strategic layer where you conquer territories across a map—sounds exciting but falls flat due to glitches and inconsistent mechanics. While it’s a fun concept, it often feels undercooked and could use more refinement.

Final Thoughts:

Despite its flaws, Ravenfield is a blast to play. Its great shooting mechanics, simple graphics, and fantastic modding potential make it a highly entertaining sandbox shooter that doesn’t take itself too seriously. While the lack of story and the glitchy Conquest mode hold it back from greatness, the core gameplay is so fun that it’s easy to forgive its shortcomings.

If you’re looking for a laid-back shooter with endless modding possibilities and a unique charm, Ravenfield is well worth a try.

Rating: 6/10

183568795.review:
싱글 ★★☆
모드 ★★☆

[h1]한줄평[/h1]
▶ 저사양 유저가 위한 배틀필드 or 콜옵을 느끼고 싶다면 추천 or 모드, 맵 제작에 관심있거나 플레이 하고싶다면 추천 or 고사양 유저라면 다른 게임 추천

[h1]장점[/h1]
[h2]▶ 저사양 유저들의 희망 배필과 콜옵을 비슷하게 느낄 수 있다.[/h2]
SteelRaven7이라는 개발자가 1인 개발을 했다고 하는데 배틀필드와 콜옵을 많이 참고 했는지 흡사한 부분이 있다.
배틀필드에서 장비를 탔을 때 C키를 눌러서 시점을 변경하는 것과 유사하고
적을 잡았을 때 킬로그로 잡았다고 알려주는 UI는 콜옵과 배필에 약간 비슷하다.

[h2]▶ AI가 움직임 패턴이 재밌다.[/h2]
레오낫 처럼 방심할때 허를 찌르는 돌격은 아직 못 봤지만
벽에 붙어서 대기하는 플레이, 벽 주변에서 살짝 qe피킹하는 모습, 분대 플레이로 기병대처럼 쐐기 포메이션으로 무지성 천천히 쏘면서 돌격 등 AI 패턴 몇 가지로 돌려 막는 듯한 느낌이다.

장점을 준 이유는 이런 패턴 돌려막기 AI 없는 게임도 많기 때문
(보통은 무지성 돌격으로 유저가 죽이기 편하거나 체력만 뻥튀기 or 에임봇 or 깡데미지만 높여둠)

[h2]▶ 남 눈치 안봐도 된다.[/h2]
배필, 스쿼드 등 장비 터지면 막대한 티켓을 지불해서 팀들의 원망을 듣는 소리를 원천 봉쇄 할 수 있다.
솔로 게임인데 봇 눈치를 봐야 하는가?

[h1]단점[/h1]
[h2]▶ 유저 모드는 있지만 공식적인 컨텐츠는 글쎄....[/h2]
컨퀘스트라고 정복 전쟁이라는 모드가 있는데 땅따먹기 게임이지만 깊이가 얉다.
땅따먹기는 언제나 재밌지만 뚫는 편법을 깨닮으면 1시간에 엔딩을 볼 수 있음.
근데 2024.12.24일 기점으로 엔딩 없음.

[h2]▶ 싱글 캠페인을 안만든다고 공식 발표함.[/h2]
얼리액세스의 폐해 로드맵 발표했지만 그게 100% 이루어진다는 보장은 없다.
최근 발표로 싱글 캠페인은 시간이 많이 들어서 그 부분보다 유저가 만들 수 있는 캠페인 에디터에 더 집중을 한다고 한다.
이거 왠지 블랙옵스 4, 배틀필드 5가 싱글 버리고 멀티에 집중한다고 했던 소리와 비슷하게 느껴지지 않나? Yes
배틀필드 3 or 4 처럼 싱글 + 멀티 잘 빠지게 만들고 배틀필드 5는 싱글 없지만 그렇다고 멀티가 대단했나? No
제가 느끼기엔 배필 3,4 멀티나 5멀티나 별반 차이를 못 느꼈다.

그래서 캠페인 에디터를 잘 만들어서 커뮤니티 모드가 얼마나 잘 활성되는가 관건이라고 느낍니다.
